home.title: Making informed decisions
home.title-description: Empowering vital decisions to make the right water management choices for you.
home.title2: We also change the lives of pastoralists.
home.title2-description: Empowering pastoralist communities with access to information, find out how we are changing their reality.
home.feature1-description: Explore our interactive map and view the location of each waterpoint in Ethiopia. Get detailed data on existing infrastructure.
home.feature2-description: Explore key characteristics of this waterpoint's surroundings and community.
home.feature3-description: Access comprehensive waterpoint data, drill down into historical temperature and precipitation records, and take advantage of seasonal and sub-seasonal forecasts to make informed decisions.
home.feature4-description: Find your path to the water! With our routing module, getting to the waterpoint has never been easier

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.description-1: Ethiopian Institute of Agricultural Research is one of the oldest and largest agricultural research institutes in Africa. EIAR was established in 1966 by Proclamation. It was then called Institute of Agricultural Research (IAR). In 1997 was renamed as Ethiopian Agricultural Research Organization (EARO). At the moment the institute is named as Ethiopian Institute Agricultural Research (EIAR).
aboutUs.description-2: The Alliance of Biodiversity International and International Center for Tropical Agriculture (ABC) delivers research-based solutions that harness agricultural biodiversity and sustainably transform food systems to improve people's lives in a climate crisis.
aboutUs.about-project-d: The Alliance of Bioversity International and International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT) in collaboration with Ethiopian Agricultural Research Institute (EIAR), the Ministry of Agriculture (MoA), the Ministry of Irrigation and Lowlands and Oromia Agricultural Research Institute (OARI), along with other key national and local institutions has been implementing a Livestock Water Monitoring and Risk Management System (LWMRMS) project in Ethiopia through financial support from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF). The project aims at providing a near real-time surface water and pasture information that are gender and socially inclusive in pastoral areas of Ethiopia. The project developed a fully working interactive and dynamic web-based digital platform (ET - Monitoring) and installed at EIAR using Human-Centered Design (HCD). ET - Monitoring  provide surface water and pasture information for pastoralists, agro-pastoralists, decision makers, humanitarian assistance providers and other stakeholders who lack access to the information in pastoral areas of Ethiopia in three languages (English, Amharic and Afan Oromo).
aboutUs.products-d: The platform provide a near real time information on:
aboutUs.products-1: Geographical location of water-points, including geospatial information and characteristics of water-points
aboutUs.products-2: Waterpoint water level or depth information
aboutUs.products-d-2: The unique nature of the platform is that provide water and pasture availability and condition information as well as advisory services for pastoralists to guide where and when to graze and water their livestock to reduce resource induced conflict. This web-platform is also used to disseminate the information daily in near-real time base. Thus, this digital platform is a first in its kind and key decision support tools to manage climate risk and enhance pastoralists’ and agro-pastoralists’ adaptive capacity. The platform can also be used by governmental organizations, non-governmental organizations, and other stakeholders for early warning and decision making
aboutUs.key-d: Ethiopian Agricultural Research Institute (EIAR), the Ministry of Agriculture (MoA), the Ministry of Irrigation and Lowlands and Oromia Agricultural Research Institute (OARI).

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description-1: We are representing the Alliance Bioversity International and CIAT and the Ethiopian Agricultural Research Institute in the Climate Action research program. We are developing a study of population living around water points in Ethiopia, the project aims to provide technology solutions to the people who may be affected by the different challenges at the water points. This study aims to collect data from these people in order to provide technological solutions such as text messages and emails when certain events occur at the water points to which they subscribe.
privacy.description-2: You, as a local resident, have been selected to participate in this interview for the following purposes:
privacy.description-3: This is for the purpose of storing it in a database so that we can send constant updates when necessary. It is important to clarify here that:
privacy.description-3-1: All information collected is confidential and will only be analyzed by researchers from the Alliance Bioversity International and CIAT and the Ethiopian Agricultural Research Institute. Because of its confidential nature, participating in this research anonymously will avoid any perceived risk of sharing your experiences and impressions of the program to be evaluated. Such confidentiality will also ensure that, except for the learning gained from your own and shared reflection of your participation in the Livesock Surface monitoring system, you will not be exposed to any risk.
privacy.description-3-2: This study will maintain the absolute confidentiality of your identity and will use the data obtained only for professional purposes, encrypting the information, and keeping it in secure files. Only researchers will have access to this information. In no case will individual persons be identified. If you have questions about the handling of your information regarding this study, you may (also) contact Sintayehu Alemayehu (s.alemayehu@cgiar.org).
privacy.description-3-3: The information you provide will be used exclusively for research purposes.
privacy.description-3-4: You may withdraw or abstain from the interview at any time. We respect your right not to respond to them.
privacy.description-3-5: If direct quotations are to be used in reports of results and/or publications, they will be used with the prior consent of the interviewee.
privacy.description-3-6: During the interview, your name, phone number, email and location will be collected due to the remote nature of the interview.
privacy.description-3-7: By signing/accepting this agreement, you acknowledge that you have been informed of the purpose of this study and agree to the above and give your consent to participate in this study.

user-profile.title: Subscribed waterpoints
user-profile.description-1: Welcome to the subscription management section of Waterpoints.
user-profile.description-2-1: We take care of keeping you up to date and making sure you are informed of any relevant updates. You have the flexibility to choose between two types of subscriptions:
user-profile.description-2-2: where you will receive notifications on a regular weekly basis, or
user-profile.description-2-3: to notify you immediately of any significant changes in the status of Waterpoint.
user-profile.no-subscription: At the moment you dont have subscriptions

advisories.title: Advisories
advisories.status-d: The states of the water point are as follows:
advisories.description-1: Advisories are informative messages designed to be sent to users once the SMS service is operational. Their fundamental purpose is to keep users updated on any changes or developments in the water status. By providing detailed information about each water point, advisories enable users to make informed decisions in real-time. From precautionary alerts to indications of seasonal scarcity, these messages offer a clear view of the water landscape, empowering users to adapt and respond appropriately.
advisories.description-2: Implementing advisories within the SMS service represents a significant step towards transparency and effective communication in water management. By receiving these notices directly on their devices, users can stay informed about any changes in water status, regardless of their location or access to other sources of information. This rapid and direct communication promotes greater awareness of local water resources and encourages more active participation in their conservation and responsible use.
advisories.description-3: Ultimately, the introduction of advisories not only informs users but also empowers their ability to make informed, strategic decisions regarding water. By fully understanding the situation of each water point and the implications of its status, users can implement proactive measures to better manage their consumption and conserve this vital resource. In summary, advisories represent an essential tool for promoting sustainability and efficiency in water management, ensuring safe and equitable access for future generations.
advisories.messages-d: Advisory for each condition of the water point
advisories.good-message: pond is in Good condition. Manage the water consumption for other purposes
advisories.watch-message: pond is in Watch condition. Reduce pond water consumption for other purposes and follow pond manager instructions
advisories.alert-message: pond is in Alert condition and advised to use the pond water for drinking and weak animals only
advisories.near-dry-message: pond is in Near-Dry condition and advised to use the pond water for drinking
advisories.seasonal-dry-message: pond is in Dry condition. please text “ponds” to get nearby available ponds
